text: Chrysothamnus greenei called Greene's rabbitbrush , is a North American species of flowering plants in the aster tribe within the sunflower family. It has been found in eastern California (Mono + Inyo Counties), Nevada, Arizona, New Mexico, Utah, Colorado, and southern Wyoming (Sweetwater County). Chrysothamnus greenei is a branching shrub up to 50 cm (20 inches) tall with gray bark. It has many small, yellow flower heads clumped into dense arrays. The species grows in sandy locations in desert regions.Flora of North America, Greene’s rabbitbrush, Chrysothamnus greenei (A. Gray) Greene ==References== Category:Astereae Category:Flora of the Northwestern United States Category:Flora of the Southwestern United States Category:Flora of the California desert regions Category:Flora of the Great Basin Category:Flora of New Mexico Category:Plants described in 1876 Category:Taxa named by Asa Gray Category:Taxa named by Edward Lee Greene
title: Chrysothamnus greenei
